newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: RESEARCH ALERT - Vickers downgrades Tiger.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Vickers downgrades Tiger.

text.p: Brokerage house Vickers Ballas said on Friday it had downgraded its recommendation on Singapore pharmaceutical company Tiger Medical Ltd to "neutral" from "outperform".
Vickers analyst Magdelene Yap told Reuters this meant the brokerage was no longer recommending people buy the stock.

A Vickers note to clients said Tiger Medical's half-year results for the six months to June 30, 1996, had been below its expectations. Net profit had fallen two percent to Singapore $3.9 million, versus Vickers' estimate of S$12.2 million for the full-year.
"The flat performance was attributed to higher costs which caused a 2.1 percentage points decline in operating margins," the Vickers note said.
"Traditionally, sales and operating margins are better in the second half. Nevertheless, we have lowered our earnings forecast by an average of 15 percent to reflect the weak interims," it added.
